dict.string: Sourcetree is Atlassian's free Git and Mercurial client for Mac and Windows.
Atlassian
www.gravatar.com
Default
Sourcetree displays the Gravatar icon for a commit author (if available) by default. You can disable it in Sourcetree's Preferences -> General section.
If you deny this connection, Gravatar icons won't be loaded for commit authors and only the placeholder will be shown.
product-downloads.atlassian.com
Essential
Sourcetree periodically checks for software updates. You can disable automatic update checks in Sourcetree's Preferences -> Update section.
If you deny this connection, you will not be notified about new versions of Sourcetree.
avatar-cdn.atlassian.com
Default
Sourcetree shows each Bitbucket account's profile avatar in the Preferences -> Accounts list.
If you deny this connection, you will only see a placeholder icon for Bitbucket accounts.
bitbucket.org
Essential
Sourcetree interacts with Bitbucket to load your user profile, list remote repositories, display build status, and create pull requests.
If you deny this connection, remote repositories from Bitbucket won't be listed in Sourcetree and any remote operations for a Bitbucket repository will fail.
bytebucket.org
Essential
Sourcetree interacts with Bitbucket and it utilizes this to serve some types of content.
If you deny this connection, content may not load appropriately for Bitbucket repositories.
githubusercontent.com
Essential
Sourcetree interacts with GitHub and it utilizes this to serve some types of content.
If you deny this connection, content may not load appropriately for GitHub accounts and repositories.
github.com
Essential
Sourcetree interacts with GitHub to load your user profile, list remote repositories, and create pull requests.
If you deny this connection, remote repositories from GitHub won't be listed in Sourcetree and any remote operations for a GitHub repository will fail.
gitlab.com
Essential
Sourcetree interacts with GitLab to load your user profile, list remote repositories, and create pull requests.
If you deny this connection, remotes repositories from GitLab won't be listed in Sourcetree and any remote operations for a GitLab repository will fail.
Essential
Sourcetree supports not only cloud hosting services but also self-hosted server solutions.
If you deny this connection, Sourcetree won't be able to connect to any unspecified server.
